DataElement.preferredName: Intra-arterial Thrombolytic Therapy At Hospital Initiation Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indication response of start use of infusions of fibrinolytic agents within an artery (blood vessel that carries blood from the heart to tissues and organs in the body) at hospital.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intra-arterial Thrombolytic Therapy At Hospital Initiation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Start use of infusions of fibrinolytic agents within an artery (blood vessel that carries blood from the heart to tissues and organs in the body) at hospital.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Within an artery (blood vessel that carries blood from the heart to tissues and organs in the body).:Use of infusions of fibrinolytic agents to destroy or dissolve thrombi in blood vessels or bypass grafts.

Concepts.definition: Within an artery (blood vessel that carries blood from the heart to tissues and organs in the body).
Any pharmacologic intervention used to destroy or dissolve a clot in a blood vessel or graft.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate position, location, or state (American Heritage Dictionary):An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.:The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate position, location, or state.
An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.
The act of starting something; an act that sets in motion some course of events.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
